text:
Hi everyone. I'm Jennifer from English with 
Jennifer. You may know that I've played

a lot of card games in my life. I grew up playing 
popular games like Blackjack, Slapjack, Go Fish,

and some less common games like Steal the Pile and 
500. I hope that card games don't die out because

of video games and entertainment apps. There 
are a lot of idioms related to playing cards,

and they sure make a lot more sense 
if you've actually played these games.
In this lesson, I'll share four expressions.

"To play your cards right" means to do things in 
the best way possible in order to be successful

and get what you want or get something of 
value. We often use this in an IF-clause.

If you play your cards right, you might 
get a promotion in one or two years.

He's a good athlete, and he could get a 
scholarship if he plays his cards right.

If you're good at keeping your face 
expressionless, then you know how to

have a poker face. You can have, keep, or wear 
a poker face. It's like keeping a straight face.

Sometimes you want to hide what 
you're thinking or feeling.

This is important in card games 
because you don't want to reveal

if you have good or bad cards. That would be 
giving too much information to your opponents.

So, imagine a business setting. During 
negotiations, Dave always has a poker

face. Until the deal is final, you don't know 
whether he's happy or not with the terms.

Sometimes winning in cards depends on skill. Other 
times, you either have good luck or bad luck. When

you draw a card from the deck, it may be a good 
card or a bad card. That's the luck of the draw.

This expression refers to chance. 
You have no control over the outcome.

I bought an economy seat on the plane, 
and I had no choice about seating.

I ended up in a row with extra leg room and empty 
seats beside me. It was just the luck of the draw.

You know, one card game I never 
had any interest in learning

is bridge. I understand though that the four 
suits are ranked: clubs, diamonds, hearts,

spades. I believe spades have the 
highest value in poker, too, so if

you have something...anything in spades, that's 
a good thing. It means you have a lot of it.

Liliana has intelligence and wit in spades. Sergei 
is very hard-working. He has ambition in spades.

Okay. Quick review. If you do things in the best 
way possible in order to be successful, you...
play your cards right.

If you don't change your expression in order 
to hide your thoughts and feelings, you...
keep a poker face.
When things depend on chance, that's just...
the luck of the draw.

If someone is very generous, we 
could say they have generosity...
in spades.

For practice, finish my 
sentences with your own ideas.

That's all for now. Please like the video 
if you found it useful and interesting.
As always, thanks for watching and happy studies!
